intro: Desmophyllum, commonly known as the staghorn coral, is a type of scleractinian coral that forms hard, calcareous structures. It belongs to the family Corallidae and is characterized by its branching, antler-like appearance. The plant thrives in shallow, warm waters of the Atlantic and Indo-Pacific oceans. Its skeletal structure provides habitat for various marine organisms. Desmophyllum plays a crucial role in coral reef ecosystems by contributing to reef framework and biodiversity.
